wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Alexander Douglas (11 September 1910 – 6 March 1943) was a Scottish professional association footballer who played as an inside forward.

response: * Tom Douglas (born 1958), American chef, restaurateur and writer

link_mentions.page: List of footballers killed during World War II
response: * Tom Douglas – played for Blackpool (1931–1933) and Burnley (1933–1936). Died on active service in French Algeria serving as a sapper in the Royal Engineers on 6 March 1943 aged 32.
